comments.body: I feel like this is testing "can't fail" kind of stuff, but maybe it's consistent with the rest of the netpol suite...
"sorta can fail" ... this will catch a regression in the impl of `createService` :)

can this only be an empty IP at this point?

if not, might be better to reword:
```
return fmt.Errorf("invalid IP address found for service %s/%s: %s", svc.Namespace, svc.Name, svc.Spec.ClusterIP)
```

https://pkg.go.dev/net#ParseIP
> If s is not a valid textual representation of an IP address, ParseIP returns nil.
It's probably worth making this param list a struct given how long the param list has become
hola, ok added in the follow on issue hope that works @bowei
